events.name: Battery technology and clean energy transition
events.wd_label: Battery technology and clean energy transition
events.wd_description: Battery technology is critical for the clean energy transition and reducing fossil fuel dependence. Governments are investing heavily in energy storage to support renewable energy adoption and lower greenhouse gas emissions. However, the demand for batteries is expected to surge, potentially leading to material shortages, particularly cobalt and lithium.
events.description: Battery technology is critical for the clean energy transition and reducing fossil fuel dependence. Governments are investing heavily in energy storage to support renewable energy adoption and lower greenhouse gas emissions. However, the demand for batteries is expected to surge, potentially leading to material shortages, particularly cobalt and lithium.

events.name: Renewable energy adoption
events.wd_description: Energy storage is essential for the adoption of renewable energy sources, which is crucial for reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
events.description: Energy storage is essential for the adoption of renewable energy sources, which is crucial for reducing greenhouse gas emissions.

events.name: Battery demand surge
events.wd_description: The demand for batteries is expected to increase dramatically in the short term as efforts to decarbonize all sectors intensify.
events.description: The demand for batteries is expected to increase dramatically in the short term as efforts to decarbonize all sectors intensify.

events.name: Material shortages
events.wd_description: The surge in battery demand could lead to shortages of critical battery materials like cobalt and lithium in the coming years.
events.description: The surge in battery demand could lead to shortages of critical battery materials like cobalt and lithium in the coming years.

events.name: Cobalt
events.wd_description: Cobalt is a critical component in lithium-ion batteries, with potential supply shortages anticipated due to increased demand.
events.description: Cobalt is a critical component in lithium-ion batteries, with potential supply shortages anticipated due to increased demand.

events.name: Lithium
events.wd_description: Lithium is another critical component in lithium-ion batteries, with potential supply shortages anticipated due to increased demand.
events.description: Lithium is another critical component in lithium-ion batteries, with potential supply shortages anticipated due to increased demand.

events.name: Risk assessment of cobalt and lithium supply
events.wd_label: Risk assessment of cobalt and lithium supply
events.wd_description: This report analyzes the risk assessment of cobalt and lithium supply chains, focusing on the entire value chains from extraction to waste management at the global level. It includes scenarios for supply and demand up to 2030 and assesses the progress of emerging battery technologies.
events.description: This report analyzes the risk assessment of cobalt and lithium supply chains, focusing on the entire value chains from extraction to waste management at the global level. It includes scenarios for supply and demand up to 2030 and assesses the progress of emerging battery technologies.

events.name: Supply and demand scenarios
events.wd_description: Scenarios for the supply and demand of cobalt and lithium up to 2030 are developed to predict the risk of supply distortions.
events.description: Scenarios for the supply and demand of cobalt and lithium up to 2030 are developed to predict the risk of supply distortions.

events.name: Emerging battery technologies and market adoption timeline
events.wd_description: The report assesses the progress and potential of new battery technologies such as solid-state, sodium-ion, lithium-sulphur, and lithium-air batteries.
events.description: The report assesses the progress and potential of new battery technologies such as solid-state, sodium-ion, lithium-sulphur, and lithium-air batteries.

events.name: Future prospects of lithium-ion batteries
events.wd_description: Despite advancements in battery technology, lithium-ion batteries will remain the dominant technology until at least 2030. Lithium cannot be substituted, but cobalt use is expected to decrease.
events.description: Despite advancements in battery technology, lithium-ion batteries will remain the dominant technology until at least 2030. Lithium cannot be substituted, but cobalt use is expected to decrease.

events.name: Dominance of lithium-ion batteries
events.wd_description: Lithium-ion batteries will continue to be the prevalent technology in use during the next decade, with lithium as a crucial constituent.
events.description: Lithium-ion batteries will continue to be the prevalent technology in use during the next decade, with lithium as a crucial constituent.

events.name: Cobalt reduction in cathode materials
events.wd_description: The trend towards cathode materials with less or no cobalt is expected to grow, reducing dependency on cobalt.
events.description: The trend towards cathode materials with less or no cobalt is expected to grow, reducing dependency on cobalt.

events.name: Geological resources and reserves of cobalt and lithium
events.wd_label: Geological resources and reserves of cobalt and lithium
events.wd_description: Large geological resources for cobalt and lithium exist globally, but current reserves are highly concentrated in a few countries. The extraction and production capabilities are crucial for meeting future demand.
events.description: Large geological resources for cobalt and lithium exist globally, but current reserves are highly concentrated in a few countries. The extraction and production capabilities are crucial for meeting future demand.

events.name: Geological resources and reserves for lithium and cobalt
events.wd_description: Estimated geological resources for lithium are 63 million tons and for cobalt are 25 million tons.
events.description: Estimated geological resources for lithium are 63 million tons and for cobalt are 25 million tons.

events.name: Geological reserves
events.wd_description: Geological reserves that can be economically extracted are estimated to be 17 million tons for lithium and 6.5 million tons for cobalt.
events.description: Geological reserves that can be economically extracted are estimated to be 17 million tons for lithium and 6.5 million tons for cobalt.

events.name: Global production of lithium and cobalt
events.wd_description: In 2019, global production from mining was approximately 88,000 tons of lithium and 144,000 tons of cobalt, with reserves concentrated in the DRC for cobalt and South America and Australia for lithium.
events.description: In 2019, global production from mining was approximately 88,000 tons of lithium and 144,000 tons of cobalt, with reserves concentrated in the DRC for cobalt and South America and Australia for lithium.

events.name: DRC cobalt production
events.wd_description: The Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) is a primary producer of cobalt.
events.description: The Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) is a primary producer of cobalt.

events.name: South American lithium production
events.wd_description: South American countries are major producers of lithium.
events.description: South American countries are major producers of lithium.

events.name: Australian lithium production
events.wd_description: Australia is a significant producer of lithium.
events.description: Australia is a significant producer of lithium.

events.name: Significant government investments in battery technology
events.description: Governments worldwide are investing significant sums in battery technology to enable the adoption of renewable energy sources and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

events.name: Potential material shortages due to battery demand surge
events.description: The dramatic increase in battery demand could result in shortages of critical materials such as cobalt and lithium in the coming years.

events.name: Comprehensive value chain analysis for cobalt and lithium
events.description: The report analyzes the entire value chains of cobalt and lithium, from extraction to waste management, to assess supply and demand scenarios.

events.name: Concentration of lithium and cobalt reserves
events.description: The current reserves of lithium and cobalt are highly concentrated, with cobalt primarily found in the DRC and lithium in South American countries and Australia.
